body_content.explanation: how well a person, machine, etc. does a piece of work or an activity:
examples: He was an experienced player who was always seeking to improve his performance.
High-performance cars (= those that are fast, powerful, and easy to control) are the most expensive.
This was a very impressive performance by the young player, who scored 14 points within the first ten minutes.

body_content.explanation: the action of entertaining other people by dancing, singing, acting, or playing music:
examples: a performance of Arthur Miller's play "The Crucible"
She gave a superb performance as Lady Macbeth.

body_content.explanation: an action or type of behaviour that involves a lot of attention to detail or to small matters that are not important:
examples: Cleaning the oven is such a performance.
What a performance! Please stop shouting!
The fish pie is a bit of a performance to make.
We managed to assemble the bookshelves eventually, but it was a real performance.
We had such a performance getting the new sofa into the house.

body_content.explanation: an occasion when an event or a situation happens again:
examples: The police hope to avoid a repeat performance of last year, when the festivities turned into rioting.
